item.title: The World Bank has released its 2017 forecast for the Thai economy
item.description:
The 2016 Thailand Economic Monitor, published today by the World Bank, projects Thailand’s economic growth to reach 3.1% in 2016 and 3.2% in 2017, surpassing the previous year’s 2.8%. The report identifies private consumption and public investments, such as rail infrastructure projects, as primary growth drivers. Tourism has also performed well in 2016, with tourist arrivals, particularly from China, rising by 13.1% in the third quarter.
